definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Most flowering plant species bear hermaphrodite flowers with functional stamens and carpels.
sentences.chinese: 大多數有花植物着生具有功能性雄蕊和雌蕊的兩性花。

sentences.english: The genesis and development of staminate flowers and the bisexual flowers of"Lanzhou melon"have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 本工作觀察了白蘭瓜雄花和兩性花的發生和發育過程。

sentences.english: Most plants are hermaphrodite and they may cross or self-fertihze.
sentences.chinese: 大多數植物都是兩性花，它們可以雜交或自交。

sentences.english: The strawberry flower, as a cyme, is bisexual.
sentences.chinese: 草莓爲聚傘花序，兩性花。

sentences.english: Its anthotaxy is spica, and amphimixis flowers is serried inserted on the thick rachis.
sentences.chinese: 穗狀花序，兩性花密集着生於粗大的花軸上。

sentences.english: In hermaphrodite flowers sex expression is controlled by floral development genes.
sentences.chinese: 花發育基因調控着兩性花的性別表達。
